titles.title: Internet Freedom Act of 2009
A bill to prohibit the Federal Communications Commission from further regulating the Internet.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

bill.summary: 10/22/2009--Introduced. Internet Freedom Act of 2009 - Prohibits the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) from proposing, promulgating, or issuing any regulations with regard to the Internet or IP-enabled services. Makes such prohibition non-applicable to regulations that are determined necessary to: (1) prevent damage to U.S. national security; (2) ensure public safety; (3) assist or facilitate any actions taken by federal and state law enforcement agencies; or (4) ensure the solvency of the Universal Service Fund.
